segment.source: Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications
segment.target: Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications

segment.source: Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications
segment.target: Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications

segment.source: Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications
segment.target: Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0.

segment.source: 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 use XML files called settings location templates to monitor and synchronize desktop application settings and Windows desktop settings between user computers.
segment.target: 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 use XML files called settings location templates to monitor and synchronize desktop application settings and Windows desktop settings between user computers.

segment.source: By default, some settings location templates are included in UE-V.
segment.target: By default, some settings location templates are included in UE-V.

segment.source: But if you want to synchronize settings for desktop applications other than those included in the default templates, you can create your own custom settings location templates by using the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: But if you want to synchronize settings for desktop applications other than those included in the default templates, you can create your own custom settings location templates by using the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: Once you have read through the planning material in Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment and have decided that you want to synchronize settings for custom applications (third-party, line-of-business, etc.), you will deploy the features of UE-V as described in this topic.
segment.target: Once you have read through the planning material in Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment and have decided that you want to synchronize settings for custom applications (third-party, line-of-business, etc.), you will deploy the features of UE-V as described in this topic.

segment.source: To start, here are the main steps required to synchronize settings for custom applications:
segment.target: To start, here are the main steps required to synchronize settings for custom applications:

segment.source: Install the UEV Generator
segment.target: Install the UEV Generator

segment.source: Use the UEV Generator to create custom XML settings location templates.
segment.target: Use the UEV Generator to create custom XML settings location templates.

segment.source: Configure a UE-V settings template catalog
segment.target: Configure a UE-V settings template catalog

segment.source: You can define this path where custom settings location templates are stored.
segment.target: You can define this path where custom settings location templates are stored.

segment.source: Create custom settings location templates
segment.target: Create custom settings location templates

segment.source: These custom templates let users sync settings for custom applications.
segment.target: These custom templates let users sync settings for custom applications.

segment.source: Deploy the custom settings location templates
segment.target: Deploy the custom settings location templates

segment.source: After you test the custom template to ensure that settings are synced correctly, you can deploy these templates in one of these ways:
segment.target: After you test the custom template to ensure that settings are synced correctly, you can deploy these templates in one of these ways:

segment.source: Through your existing deployment infrastructure, such as Configuration Manager
segment.target: Through your existing deployment infrastructure, such as Configuration Manager

segment.source: By using Group Policy preferences
segment.target: By using Group Policy preferences

segment.source: Deploy a UE-V settings template catalog
segment.target: Deploy a UE-V settings template catalog

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Templates that are deployed by using ESD or Group Policy must be registered with UE-V Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) or Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Templates that are deployed by using ESD or Group Policy must be registered with UE-V Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) or Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Prepare to Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications
segment.target: Prepare to Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications

segment.source: Before you start deploying the UE-V features that handle custom applications, there are just a couple things to review.
segment.target: Before you start deploying the UE-V features that handle custom applications, there are just a couple things to review.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator
segment.target: The UE-V Generator

segment.source: The UE-V Generator monitors an application to discover and capture the locations where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator monitors an application to discover and capture the locations where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: The application that is monitored must be a traditional application.
segment.target: The application that is monitored must be a traditional application.

segment.source: You use the UE-V Generator to create settings location templates, but it cannot create a settings location template from these application types:
segment.target: You use the UE-V Generator to create settings location templates, but it cannot create a settings location template from these application types:

segment.source: Virtualized applications
segment.target: Virtualized applications

segment.source: Applications that are offered through Terminal Services
segment.target: Applications that are offered through Terminal Services

segment.source: Java applications
segment.target: Java applications

segment.source: Windows apps
segment.target: Windows apps

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: UE-V settings location templates cannot be created from virtualized applications or Terminal Services applications.
segment.target: UE-V settings location templates cannot be created from virtualized applications or Terminal Services applications.

segment.source: However, settings that are synchronized by using the templates can be applied to those applications.
segment.target: However, settings that are synchronized by using the templates can be applied to those applications.

segment.source: To create templates that support Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) and Terminal Services applications, open a version of the Windows Installer (.msi) package of the application by using the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: To create templates that support Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) and Terminal Services applications, open a version of the Windows Installer (.msi) package of the application by using the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: For more information about synchronizing settings for virtual applications, see Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications.
segment.target: For more information about synchronizing settings for virtual applications, see Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications.

segment.source: Excluded Locations: The discovery process excludes locations that commonly store application software files that do not synchronize settings well between user computers or computing environments.
segment.target: Excluded Locations: The discovery process excludes locations that commonly store application software files that do not synchronize settings well between user computers or computing environments.

segment.source: By default, these are excluded:
segment.target: By default, these are excluded:

segment.source: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files to which the logged-on user cannot write values
segment.target: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files to which the logged-on user cannot write values

segment.source: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files that are associated with the core functionality of the Windows operating system
segment.target: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files that are associated with the core functionality of the Windows operating system

segment.source: All registry keys that are located in the HKEYLOCALMACHINE hive
segment.target: All registry keys that are located in the HKEYLOCALMACHINE hive

segment.source: Files that are located in Program Files directories
segment.target: Files that are located in Program Files directories

segment.source: Files that are located in Users User name AppData LocalLow
segment.target: Files that are located in Users User name AppData LocalLow

segment.source: Windows operating system files that are located in %Systemroot%
segment.target: Windows operating system files that are located in %Systemroot%

segment.source: If registry keys and files that are stored in excluded locations are required to synchronize application settings, you can manually add the locations to the settings location template during the template creation process.
segment.target: If registry keys and files that are stored in excluded locations are required to synchronize application settings, you can manually add the locations to the settings location template during the template creation process.

segment.source: Replace the default Microsoft templates
segment.target: Replace the default Microsoft templates

segment.source: The UE-V Agent installs a default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent installs a default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings.

segment.source: If you customize these templates, or create settings location templates to synchronize settings for custom applications, the UE-V Agent can be configured to use a settings template catalog to store the templates.
segment.target: If you customize these templates, or create settings location templates to synchronize settings for custom applications, the UE-V Agent can be configured to use a settings template catalog to store the templates.

segment.source: In this case, you will need to include the default templates along with the custom templates in the settings template catalog.
segment.target: In this case, you will need to include the default templates along with the custom templates in the settings template catalog.

segment.source: When you Deploy a UE-V Agent, you can use the command-line parameter to disable the registration of the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: When you Deploy a UE-V Agent, you can use the command-line parameter to disable the registration of the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: When you use Group Policy to configure the settings template catalog path, you can choose to replace the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: When you use Group Policy to configure the settings template catalog path, you can choose to replace the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: If you configure the policy settings to replace the default Microsoft templates, all of the default Microsoft templates that are installed by the UE-V Agent are deleted and only the templates that are located in the settings template catalog are used.
segment.target: If you configure the policy settings to replace the default Microsoft templates, all of the default Microsoft templates that are installed by the UE-V Agent are deleted and only the templates that are located in the settings template catalog are used.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent configuration setting parameter must be set to true in order to override the default Microsoft template.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent configuration setting parameter must be set to true in order to override the default Microsoft template.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting after it has been enabled, the UE-V Agent does not restore the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting after it has been enabled, the UE-V Agent does not restore the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: If there are customized templates in the settings template catalog that use the same ID as the default Microsoft templates, and the UE-V Agent is not configured to replace the default Microsoft templates, the Microsoft templates are ignored.
segment.target: If there are customized templates in the settings template catalog that use the same ID as the default Microsoft templates, and the UE-V Agent is not configured to replace the default Microsoft templates, the Microsoft templates are ignored.

segment.source: You can also replace the default templates by using the UE-V Windows PowerShell features.
segment.target: You can also replace the default templates by using the UE-V Windows PowerShell features.

segment.source: To replace the default Microsoft template with Windows PowerShell, unregister all of the default Microsoft templates, and then register the customized templates.
segment.target: To replace the default Microsoft template with Windows PowerShell, unregister all of the default Microsoft templates, and then register the customized templates.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Old settings packages remain in the settings storage location even if you deploy new settings location templates for an application.
segment.target: Old settings packages remain in the settings storage location even if you deploy new settings location templates for an application.

segment.source: These packages are not read by the agent, but neither are they automatically deleted.
segment.target: These packages are not read by the agent, but neither are they automatically deleted.

segment.source: Install the UEV 2.x Generator
segment.target: Install the UEV 2.x Generator

segment.source: Install the Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Generator on a computer that you can then use to create a custom settings location template.
segment.target: Install the Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 Generator on a computer that you can then use to create a custom settings location template.

segment.source: This computer should have the applications installed for which custom settings location templates are to be generated.
segment.target: This computer should have the applications installed for which custom settings location templates are to be generated.

segment.source: To install the UE-V Generator
segment.target: To install the UE-V Generator

segment.source: As a user with local administrator rights, locate the UE-V Generator installation file ToolSetup.exe provided with the UE-V software.
segment.target: As a user with local administrator rights, locate the UE-V Generator installation file ToolSetup.exe provided with the UE-V software.

segment.source: Or, if you know the computer architecture, you can run the appropriate Windows Installer (.msi) file, ToolsSetupx64.msi or ToolsSetupx86.msi.
segment.target: Or, if you know the computer architecture, you can run the appropriate Windows Installer (.msi) file, ToolsSetupx64.msi or ToolsSetupx86.msi.

segment.source: Double-click the installation file.
segment.target: Double-click the installation file.

segment.source: The User Experience Virtualization Generator Setup wizard opens.
segment.target: The User Experience Virtualization Generator Setup wizard opens.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Accept the Microsoft Software License Terms, and then click Next.
segment.target: Accept the Microsoft Software License Terms, and then click Next.

segment.source: Click the options for Microsoft Updates and the Customer Experience Improvement Program.
segment.target: Click the options for Microsoft Updates and the Customer Experience Improvement Program.

segment.source: Select the destination folder in which to install the UE-V Generator, and then click Next.
segment.target: Select the destination folder in which to install the UE-V Generator, and then click Next.

segment.source: Click Install to begin the installation.
segment.target: Click Install to begin the installation.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A prompt for User Account Control appears before the application is installed.
segment.target: A prompt for User Account Control appears before the application is installed.

segment.source: Permission is required to install the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: Permission is required to install the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: Click Finish to close the wizard after the installation is finished.
segment.target: Click Finish to close the wizard after the installation is finished.

segment.source: You must restart your computer before you can run the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: You must restart your computer before you can run the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: To verify that the installation was successful, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization, and then click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Generator.
segment.target: To verify that the installation was successful, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization, and then click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Generator.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The UE-V 2 Generator can only be used to create templates for UE-V 2 Agents.
segment.target: The UE-V 2 Generator can only be used to create templates for UE-V 2 Agents.

segment.source: In a mixed deployment of UE-V 1.0 Agents and UE-V 2 Agents, you should continue to use the UE-V 1.0 Generator until you have upgraded all UE-V Agents.
segment.target: In a mixed deployment of UE-V 1.0 Agents and UE-V 2 Agents, you should continue to use the UE-V 1.0 Generator until you have upgraded all UE-V Agents.

segment.source: Deploy a Settings Template Catalog
segment.target: Deploy a Settings Template Catalog

segment.source: The User Experience Virtualization settings template catalog is a folder path on UE-V computers or a Server Message Block (SMB) network share that stores all the custom settings location templates.
segment.target: The User Experience Virtualization settings template catalog is a folder path on UE-V computers or a Server Message Block (SMB) network share that stores all the custom settings location templates.

segment.source: A scheduled task in the UE-V Agent checks this location one time each day and updates its synchronization behavior, based on the templates in this folder.
segment.target: A scheduled task in the UE-V Agent checks this location one time each day and updates its synchronization behavior, based on the templates in this folder.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent registers templates that were added or updated in this folder after the last time that the folder was checked and unregisters templates that are removed.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent registers templates that were added or updated in this folder after the last time that the folder was checked and unregisters templates that are removed.

segment.source: By default, templates are registered and unregistered one time per day at 3:30 A.M.
segment.target: By default, templates are registered and unregistered one time per day at 3:30 A.M.

segment.source: local time by the Task Scheduler and at system startup.
segment.target: local time by the Task Scheduler and at system startup.

segment.source: To customize the frequency of this scheduled task, see Changing the Frequency of UE-V 2.x Scheduled Tasks.
segment.target: To customize the frequency of this scheduled task, see Changing the Frequency of UE-V 2.x Scheduled Tasks.

segment.source: You can configure the settings template catalog path by using the installation command-line options, Group Policy, WMI, or Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: You can configure the settings template catalog path by using the installation command-line options, Group Policy, WMI, or Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Templates that are stored at the settings template catalog path are automatically registered and unregistered by a scheduled task.
segment.target: Templates that are stored at the settings template catalog path are automatically registered and unregistered by a scheduled task.

segment.source: To configure the settings template catalog for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: To configure the settings template catalog for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Create a new folder on the computer that stores the UE-V settings template catalog.
segment.target: Create a new folder on the computer that stores the UE-V settings template catalog.

segment.source: Set the following share-level (SMB) permissions for the settings template catalog folder.
segment.target: Set the following share-level (SMB) permissions for the settings template catalog folder.

segment.source: User account
segment.target: User account

segment.source: Recommended permissions
segment.target: Recommended permissions

segment.source: Everyone
segment.target: Everyone

segment.source: No Permissions
segment.target: No Permissions

segment.source: Domain Computers
segment.target: Domain Computers

segment.source: Read Permission Levels
segment.target: Read Permission Levels

segment.source: Administrators
segment.target: Administrators

segment.source: Read/Write Permission Levels
segment.target: Read/Write Permission Levels

segment.source: Set the following NTFS file system permissions for the settings template catalog folder.
segment.target: Set the following NTFS file system permissions for the settings template catalog folder.

segment.source: User account
segment.target: User account

segment.source: Recommended permissions
segment.target: Recommended permissions

segment.source: Apply to
segment.target: Apply to

segment.source: Creator/Owner
segment.target: Creator/Owner

segment.source: Full Control
segment.target: Full Control

segment.source: This Folder, Subfolders and Files
segment.target: This Folder, Subfolders and Files

segment.source: Domain Computers
segment.target: Domain Computers

segment.source: List Folder Contents and Read
segment.target: List Folder Contents and Read

segment.source: This Folder, Subfolders and Files
segment.target: This Folder, Subfolders and Files

segment.source: Everyone
segment.target: Everyone

segment.source: No Permissions
segment.target: No Permissions

segment.source: No Permissions
segment.target: No Permissions

segment.source: Administrators
segment.target: Administrators

segment.source: Full Control
segment.target: Full Control

segment.source: This Folder, Subfolders and Files
segment.target: This Folder, Subfolders and Files

segment.source: Click OK to close the dialog boxes.
segment.target: Click OK to close the dialog boxes.

segment.source: At a minimum, the network share must grant permissions for the Domain Computers group.
segment.target: At a minimum, the network share must grant permissions for the Domain Computers group.

segment.source: In addition, grant access permissions for the network share folder to administrators who are to manage the stored templates.
segment.target: In addition, grant access permissions for the network share folder to administrators who are to manage the stored templates.

segment.source: Create Custom Settings Location Templates
segment.target: Create Custom Settings Location Templates

segment.source: Use the UE-V Generator to create settings location templates for line-of-business applications or other custom applications.
segment.target: Use the UE-V Generator to create settings location templates for line-of-business applications or other custom applications.

segment.source: After the template for an application is created, you can deploy it to computers so that settings are synchronized for that application.
segment.target: After the template for an application is created, you can deploy it to computers so that settings are synchronized for that application.

segment.source: To create a UE-V settings location template with the UE-V Generator
segment.target: To create a UE-V settings location template with the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization, and then click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Generator.
segment.target: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization, and then click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Generator.

segment.source: Click Create a settings location template.
segment.target: Click Create a settings location template.

segment.source: Specify the application.
segment.target: Specify the application.

segment.source: Browse to the file path of the application (.exe) or the application shortcut (.lnk) for which you want to create a settings location template.
segment.target: Browse to the file path of the application (.exe) or the application shortcut (.lnk) for which you want to create a settings location template.

segment.source: Specify the command-line arguments, if any, and working directory, if any.
segment.target: Specify the command-line arguments, if any, and working directory, if any.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before the application is started, the system displays a prompt for User Account Control.
segment.target: Before the application is started, the system displays a prompt for User Account Control.

segment.source: Permission is required to monitor the registry and file locations that the application uses to store settings.
segment.target: Permission is required to monitor the registry and file locations that the application uses to store settings.

segment.source: After the application starts, close the application.
segment.target: After the application starts, close the application.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator records the locations where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator records the locations where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: After the process is completed, click Next to continue.
segment.target: After the process is completed, click Next to continue.

segment.source: Review and select the check boxes that are next to the appropriate registry settings locations and settings file locations to synchronize for this application.
segment.target: Review and select the check boxes that are next to the appropriate registry settings locations and settings file locations to synchronize for this application.

segment.source: The list includes the following two categories for settings locations:
segment.target: The list includes the following two categories for settings locations:

segment.source: Standard: Application settings that are stored in the registry under the HKEYCURRENTUSER keys or in the file folders under UsersUser nameAppDataRoaming.
segment.target: Standard: Application settings that are stored in the registry under the HKEYCURRENTUSER keys or in the file folders under UsersUser nameAppDataRoaming.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator includes these settings by default.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator includes these settings by default.

segment.source: Nonstandard: Application settings that are stored outside the locations are specified in the best practices for settings data storage (optional).
segment.target: Nonstandard: Application settings that are stored outside the locations are specified in the best practices for settings data storage (optional).

segment.source: These include files and folders under UsersUser nameAppDataLocal.
segment.target: These include files and folders under UsersUser nameAppDataLocal.

segment.source: Review these locations to determine whether to include them in the settings location template.
segment.target: Review these locations to determine whether to include them in the settings location template.

segment.source: Select the locations check boxes to include them.
segment.target: Select the locations check boxes to include them.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Review and edit any Properties, Registry locations, and Files locations for the settings location template.
segment.target: Review and edit any Properties, Registry locations, and Files locations for the settings location template.

segment.source: Edit the following properties on the Properties tab:
segment.target: Edit the following properties on the Properties tab:

segment.source: Application Name: The application name that is written in the description of the program files properties.
segment.target: Application Name: The application name that is written in the description of the program files properties.

segment.source: Program name: The name of the program that is taken from the program file properties.
segment.target: Program name: The name of the program that is taken from the program file properties.

segment.source: This name usually has the .exe file name extension.
segment.target: This name usually has the .exe file name extension.

segment.source: Product version: The product version number of the .exe file of the application.
segment.target: Product version: The product version number of the .exe file of the application.

segment.source: This property, in conjunction with the File version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.
segment.target: This property, in conjunction with the File version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.

segment.source: This property accepts a major version number.
segment.target: This property accepts a major version number.

segment.source: If this property is empty, the settings location template applies to all versions of the product.
segment.target: If this property is empty, the settings location template applies to all versions of the product.

segment.source: File version: The file version number of the .exe file of the application.
segment.target: File version: The file version number of the .exe file of the application.

segment.source: This property, in conjunction with the Product version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.
segment.target: This property, in conjunction with the Product version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.

segment.source: This property accepts a major version number.
segment.target: This property accepts a major version number.

segment.source: If this property is empty, the settings location template applies to all versions of the program.
segment.target: If this property is empty, the settings location template applies to all versions of the program.

segment.source: Template author name (optional): The name of the settings location template author.
segment.target: Template author name (optional): The name of the settings location template author.

segment.source: Template author email (optional): The email address of the settings location template author.
segment.target: Template author email (optional): The email address of the settings location template author.

segment.source: The Registry tab lists the Key and Scope of the registry locations that are included in the settings location template.
segment.target: The Registry tab lists the Key and Scope of the registry locations that are included in the settings location template.

segment.source: Edit the registry locations by using the Tasks drop-down menu.
segment.target: Edit the registry locations by using the Tasks drop-down menu.

segment.source: Tasks enable you to add new keys, edit the name or scope of existing keys, delete keys, and browse the registry where the keys are located.
segment.target: Tasks enable you to add new keys, edit the name or scope of existing keys, delete keys, and browse the registry where the keys are located.

segment.source: Use the All Settings scope to include all the registry settings under the specified key.
segment.target: Use the All Settings scope to include all the registry settings under the specified key.

segment.source: Use the All Settings and Subkeys to include all the registry settings under the specified key, subkeys, and subkey settings.
segment.target: Use the All Settings and Subkeys to include all the registry settings under the specified key, subkeys, and subkey settings.

segment.source: The Files tab lists the file path and file mask of the file locations that are included in the settings location template.
segment.target: The Files tab lists the file path and file mask of the file locations that are included in the settings location template.

segment.source: Edit the file locations by use of the Tasks drop-down menu.
segment.target: Edit the file locations by use of the Tasks drop-down menu.

segment.source: Tasks for file locations enable you to add new files or folder locations, edit the scope of existing files or folders, delete files or folders, and open the selected location in Windows Explorer.
segment.target: Tasks for file locations enable you to add new files or folder locations, edit the scope of existing files or folders, delete files or folders, and open the selected location in Windows Explorer.

segment.source: Leave the file mask empty to include all files in the specified folder.
segment.target: Leave the file mask empty to include all files in the specified folder.

segment.source: Click Create, and then click Save to save the settings location template on the computer.
segment.target: Click Create, and then click Save to save the settings location template on the computer.

segment.source: Click Close to close the Settings Template Wizard.
segment.target: Click Close to close the Settings Template Wizard.

segment.source: Exit the UE-V Generator application.
segment.target: Exit the UE-V Generator application.

segment.source: After you have created the settings location template for an application, you should test the template.
segment.target: After you have created the settings location template for an application, you should test the template.

segment.source: Deploy the template in a lab environment before you put it into production in the enterprise.
segment.target: Deploy the template in a lab environment before you put it into production in the enterprise.

segment.source: Application Template Schema Reference for UE-V details the XML structure of the UE-V settings location template and provides guidance for editing these files.
segment.target: Application Template Schema Reference for UE-V details the XML structure of the UE-V settings location template and provides guidance for editing these files.

segment.source: Deploy the Custom Settings Location Templates
segment.target: Deploy the Custom Settings Location Templates

segment.source: After you create a settings location template with the UE-V Generator, you should test it to ensure that the application settings are synchronized correctly.
segment.target: After you create a settings location template with the UE-V Generator, you should test it to ensure that the application settings are synchronized correctly.

segment.source: You can then safely deploy the settings location template to computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: You can then safely deploy the settings location template to computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Settings location templates can be deployed by using one of these methods:
segment.target: Settings location templates can be deployed by using one of these methods:

segment.source: An enterprise software distribution (ESD) system such as System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: An enterprise software distribution (ESD) system such as System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: Group Policy preferences
segment.target: Group Policy preferences

segment.source: A UE-V settings template catalog
segment.target: A UE-V settings template catalog

segment.source: Templates that are deployed by using an ESD system or Group Policy Objects must be registered through UE-V Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) or Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Templates that are deployed by using an ESD system or Group Policy Objects must be registered through UE-V Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) or Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Templates that are stored in the settings template catalog location are automatically registered by the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Templates that are stored in the settings template catalog location are automatically registered by the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: To use the settings template catalog path to deploy UE-V settings location templates
segment.target: To use the settings template catalog path to deploy UE-V settings location templates

segment.source: Browse to the network share folder that is defined as the settings template catalog.
segment.target: Browse to the network share folder that is defined as the settings template catalog.

segment.source: Add, remove, or update settings location templates in the settings template catalog to reflect the UE-V Agent template configuration that you want for UE-V computers.
segment.target: Add, remove, or update settings location templates in the settings template catalog to reflect the UE-V Agent template configuration that you want for UE-V computers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Templates on computers are updated daily.
segment.target: Templates on computers are updated daily.

segment.source: The update is based on changes to the settings template catalog.
segment.target: The update is based on changes to the settings template catalog.

segment.source: To manually update templates on a computer that runs the UE-V Agent, open an elevated command prompt, and browse to %Program Files%Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Agent x86 or x64 , and then run ApplySettingsTemplateCatalog.exe.
segment.target: To manually update templates on a computer that runs the UE-V Agent, open an elevated command prompt, and browse to %Program Files%Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Agent x86 or x64 , and then run ApplySettingsTemplateCatalog.exe.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This program runs automatically during computer startup and daily at 3:30 A. M.
segment.target: This program runs automatically during computer startup and daily at 3:30 A. M.

segment.source: to gather any new templates that were recently added to the catalog.
segment.target: to gather any new templates that were recently added to the catalog.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for UE-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
